verses.kjv: Woe to them that are at ease in Zion, and trust in the mountain of Samaria, which are named chief of the nations, to whom the house of Israel came!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who live comfortably in Zion and for those who feel secure on the mountain of Samaria — you prominent leaders of the foremost nation, to whom the people of Israel turn!

verses.kjv: Pass ye unto Calneh, and see; and from thence go ye to Hamath the great: then go down to Gath of the Philistines: be they better than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border?
verses.ct: Go over to Calneh and take a look. From there, travel to Hamath the great. Then go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are they really better off than your 2 kingdoms? Is their territory larger than yours?

verses.kjv: Ye that put far away the evil day, and cause the seat of violence to come near;
verses.ct: You push away any thought of the day of disaster, yet you bring the reign of violence closer.

verses.kjv: That lie upon beds of ivory, and stretch themselves upon their couches, and eat the lambs out of the flock, and the calves out of the midst of the stall;
verses.ct: You lounge on ivory-decorated beds and sprawl out on your couches, feasting on tender lambs from the flock and fattened calves from the pen.

verses.kjv: That chant to the sound of the viol, and invent to themselves instruments of musick, like David;
verses.ct: You improvise songs to the sound of the harp and compose musical instruments for yourselves, just like David did.

verses.kjv: That drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with the chief ointments: but they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
verses.ct: You gulp down wine by the bowlful and rub yourselves with the finest oils — but you couldn't care less about the ruin of Joseph's descendants.

verses.kjv: Therefore now shall they go captive with the first that go captive, and the banquet of them that stretched themselves shall be removed.
verses.ct: So they will be the first to go into exile, and the feasting of those who sprawled around will come to an end.

verses.kjv: The Lord GOD hath sworn by himself, saith the LORD the God of hosts, I abhor the excellency of Jacob, and hate his palaces: therefore will I deliver up the city with all that is therein.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD has sworn by himself — the LORD, God of Armies, declares: 'I despise the arrogance of Jacob, and I hate his fortresses. I will hand over the city along with everything in it.'

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house, that they shall die.
verses.ct: If 10 people are left in a single house, they will all die.

verses.kjv: And a man’s uncle shall take him up, and he that burneth him, to bring out the bones out of the house, and shall say unto him that is by the sides of the house, Is there yet any with thee? and he shall say, No. Then shall he say, Hold thy tongue: for we may not make mention of the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: When a relative comes with the one who cremates the bodies to carry the remains out of the house, he will call to anyone still inside, 'Is anyone else in there with you?' And the answer will come back, 'No one.' Then he will say, 'Be quiet! We must not even speak the name of the LORD.'

verses.kjv: For, behold, the LORD commandeth, and he will smite the great house with breaches, and the little house with clefts.
verses.ct: Pay attention — the LORD gives the command, and the large house will be shattered to pieces, and the small house will be cracked apart.

verses.kjv: Shall horses run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen? for ye have turned judgment into gall, and the fruit of righteousness into hemlock:
verses.ct: Do horses gallop across rocky cliffs? Does anyone plow the sea with oxen? Yet you have turned justice into poison and the fruit of righteousness into something bitter.

verses.kjv: Ye which rejoice in a thing of nought, which say, Have we not taken to us horns by our own strength?
verses.ct: You celebrate over nothing, saying, 'Haven't we gained power through our own strength?'

verses.kjv: But, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O house of Israel, saith the LORD the God of hosts; and they shall afflict you from the entering in of Hemath unto the river of the wilderness.
verses.ct: But look — I am going to raise up a nation against you, house of Israel, declares the LORD, God of Armies. They will oppress you from the entrance of Hamath all the way down to the river of the Arabah.
